image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives About this object

profileText: A Delegate from the Territory of Hawaii; born in Honolulu, Island of Oahu, Hawaii, December 17, 1886; attended St. Louis School at Honolulu and Honolulu High School; was graduated from the United States Naval Academy, Annapolis, Md., in 1910; served in the United States Navy from 1910 until 1924, when he resigned with the rank of lieutenant commander; engaged in the real estate and insurance business in Honolulu in 1925; member of the board of supervisors of the city and county of Honolulu 1932-1934; elected as a Republican to the Seventy-fourth and to the three succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1935-January 3, 1943); was renominated in 1942, but withdrew to accept a commission as lieutenant commander in the United States Naval Reserve; was promoted to commander and later to captain and served in the central Pacific area from January 4, 1943, to February 21, 1946; delegate to the Republican National Conventions in 1936, 1940, 1948, and 1952; member of Governor's Emergency Housing Committee in 1946; member of Hawaii Statehood Commission in 1947 and chairman from 1949 to 1953; president of constitutional convention in 1950; appointed Governor of Hawaii by President Eisenhower and served from February 28, 1953, until his resignation July 31, 1957; died on March 24, 1959, in Honolulu, Hawaii; interment at National Memorial Cemetery of the Pacific, Honolulu, Hawaii.

note.content: Election unsuccessfully contested by Lincoln L. McCandless.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: "Samuel Wilder King" in Asian and Pacific Islander Americans in Congress, 1900-2017. Prepared under the direction of the Committee on House Administration by the Office of the Historian and the Office of the Clerk, U.S. House of Representatives. Washington: Government Publishing Office, 2018.

researchRecord.name: In the Committee on Statehood Plebiscite Records, 1939-1940, 2 negative microfilm reels.
researchRecord.description: The records include papers of Samuel Wilder King regarding the plebiscite, minutes of the meetings of the committee and related papers, a listing of the plebiscite vote for Hawaii County, and the assignment schedule of the committee's executive secretary, William Cogswell.

parentRecordLocation.name: University of Hawaii at Manoa Libraries
